required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Artesunate Ointment for the Treatment of High Grade Vulvar Intraepithelial Neoplasia (HSIL VIN2/3)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Proof-of-Concept Study of Artesunate Ointment for the Treatment of Patients With High-Grade Vulvar Intraepithelial Neoplasia (HSIL VIN 2/3)

lead_sponsor.agency: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

clinical_study.source: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase I, proof-of-concept treatment study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and feasibility of topical artesunate ointment to treat high grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (HSIL VIN2/3).

detailed_description.textblock:
Phase I open-label dose escalation study of topical artesunate, formulated as ointment, in the treatment of adult females with biopsy-confirmed HSIL VIN2/3. Fifteen (15) subjects will undergo up to a total of three cycles of topical artesunate. The first cycle will be initiated on Day 0, the second at Week 2, and the third and final cycle at week 4.
Primary Objective:
To evaluate the safety and tolerability of artesunate ointment applied topically on VIN2/3 lesions
To measure the effect of artesunate ointment on histologic regression of HSIL/VIN2/3 to VIN1 or less, confirmed by a colposcopically-directed biopsy, at study week 15.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of artesunate ointment applied topically on VIN2/3 lesions as assessed by number of participants experiencing serious adverse events or dose-limiting toxicities
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with study-related serious adverse events or dose-limiting toxicities assessed using Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 4.0 (CTCAE v4.0) criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of artesunate ointment as assessed by number of participants with regression to VIN1 or less at week 15
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with histologic regression of HSIL/VIN2/3 to VIN1 or less on colposcopically-directed biopsy, at study week 15 after receiving artesunate ointment therapy.

arm_group.description: Patients enrolled in this treatment group will receive one 5-day cycle of artesunate ointment applied topically to the vulva at week 0.
Patients enrolled in this treatment group will receive two 5-day cycles of artesunate ointment applied topically to the vulva at weeks 0 and 2.
Patients enrolled in this treatment group will receive three 5-day cycles of artesunate ointment applied topically to the vulva at weeks 0, 2, and 4.

intervention.description: artesunate formulated as an ointment to be applied topically to the vulva

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Colposcopically-directed biopsy diagnosis of high-grade vulvar dysplasia (VIN2, VIN3, VIN2/3, HSIL), including both new and recurrent disease.
- Females of childbearing potential: negative urine pregnancy test
- Ability to provide informed consent
- Ability to collaborate with planned follow-up (transportation, compliance history, etc.)
- Use of contraception through the study exit visit (week 28)
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of anal, vulvar, cervical or oropharyngeal HPV cancers
- History of any other malignancy, except for non-melanoma skin lesions
- Cluster of differentiation 4 (CD4) count < 200 at the time of screening for eligibility.
- Unable to provide informed consent
- Currently receiving systemic chemotherapy or radiation therapy for another cancer.
- Pregnant females

eligibility.gender_description: This study is for vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia, therefore it is only offerred to women.

overall_contact.last_name: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins
